tweets.text: @SuzVW @EnvAgency @AaronBell4NUL @StinkStopthe It's unbearable. It woke me up again this morning & made me physically sick because the odour is so foul. It gets trapped in the house because we can't open the windows ü§Æ I really don't know what to do anymore. I'm not sure how long we can go on being poisoned in our own homes.
@SianieRoo @poppers82 @PHE_EoEngland @EnvAgency Horrendous, shouldn't have to live like this, homes turned Into toxic tombs night after night, been bad all day  today.

Good lord.The landfill gas is eye watering in the Westlands,seeped into the house gassing my 3 year old in his bed as we speak& I‚Äôm inhaling it in my living room(doors&windows closed).Sore throat with prickling sensation,asthmatic chest tightening @PHE_EoEngland @EnvAgency
@StinkStopthe @MrMarkwarren1 @BBCPanorama @EnvAgencyMids @Cap_it_off Looks like new rubbish to me. Took this morning 10/04 @ 10 https://t.co/MGYUqCX6KT

tweets.text: @SimonTagg @EnvAgencyMids @StinkStopthe @AaronBell4NUL It‚Äôs awful on the Westlands. People can‚Äôt continue to live like this. I keep hoping the completion of the work EA have outlined will improve it but I am not hopeful. It is a human right to breath clean air and  not to feel like you are being gassed in your own home.
@SimonTagg @EnvAgencyMids @StinkStopthe @AaronBell4NUL Plan B is to slap the other wrist.

Dear @Jacob_Rees_Mogg & @EnvAgencySW. We had to go all the way to a public inquiry, without the support of @bathnes, to stop Mark Foley dumping asbestos in this quarry. So he dumps 100,000 tons of hazardous-waste instead. We warned you. Repeatedly. There must be another inquiry. https://t.co/skkkjIGeT3

tweets.text:
"We do know that local volunteers are pulling sanitary waste out of the river just upstream of 'Hackney Beach'." The reality of England's rivers.

And the @EnvAgency does what exactly?

https://t.co/rdKF8KpJFu
